title: Workflows in Galaxy
blurb: Running full analyses in Galaxy with workflows.
intro: Workflows are Galaxyâ€™s chief mechanism for reproducibility. They allow a user to exactly recreate entire analyses they have performed previously, or simply assemble a pipeline from the ground up. Further, these workflows can be edited to tailor individual tool's parameters in the workflow to new data.

topics.title: Extract Workflows from Analyses
topics.intro: Generate Reproducible Workflows from Your Analysis

slides.text: After perorming an analysis, you can create a Galaxy workflow to recreate it on new data.
Click the gear icon on the top right of the history panel to bring up the history actions menu. Click 'Extract Workflow'.
The workflow extraction page will appear, from which you can customize your workflow and select which items are included/excluded.

To prevent tools/datasets in the history from being added in the workflow, simply click their associated checkboxes. You can also select/deselect en masse using the 'check/uncheck all' buttons at the top of the page.
Name your workflow in the textbox at the top of the page.
When ready, click 'Create Workflow'.
The blue popup will appear to show the workflow has been created.
To access your workflows, click the 'Workflows' tab in the masthead.
You will find all available workflows, including the newly created one, in the rows on the Workflows page. Click their associated play button to run them.

topics.title: Modify Workflows with the Workflow Editor
topics.intro: Edit Workflows for New Data or Analyses

slides.text: Access the workflows menu from the 'Workflows' tab in the masthead.
Click the arrow next to the workflow to be run. Alternatively, click the 'Create' botton on the top right to build a workflow from scratch.
On an existing workflow, select 'Edit' from the drop down menu to open the workflow editor.
This is the workflow editor. Here you can see the entirety of your workflow, or zoom in on a specific part using the zoom buttons on the bottom left, and click-and-drag movement controls.
To add a tool, find it in the toolbar to the left, as you would to run it normally. The tool will appear as a bubble to the right.
To move items in the editor, click and drag them to the desired location.
The bubbles next to parameters in steps denote inputs and outputs. To start a connection, click on the output bubble of a step and drag it so the connection line is visible.
Attatch the connection to the input bubble of the following step. The output file must be the proper format for the input of the following tool to be connected.
To disconnect items in the editor, simply click the input bubble on the step.

slides.alt: Delete or duplicate items in the editor
slides.text: To delete a step, click the 'X' at the top left. The icon next to that will duplicate the steps's tool in the editor.

slides.alt: Edit tool parameters in the workflow editor
slides.text: To change the parameters of a tool here, click the tool's bubble and edit in the menu that appears to the right in the same way as with a normal tool form.

When ready, you may save the workflow as-is with the save button on the top right. The other buttons here allow you to edit the workflow metadata (i.e. rename it, annotate, etc.), download the workflow file, or run the workflow immediately.

topics.title: Importing and Running Workflows
topics.intro: Obtaining previously-run analyses from yourself or others, and recreating existing analyses.

slides.text: Go to the 'Workflow' tab on the masthead to begin.
On this page you can view all available workflows. Click the 'Import' button to add a new workflow from a file or a url.
The import page gives you multiple methods of adding workflows from outside of the instance. This will focus on the URL-based import and the local file import.
Clicking the 'Archived Workflow File' selector allows a .ga file into your instance to run the associated workflow using your local file browser.
The 'Archived Workflow URL' textbox allows a remote file to be requested from an outside site such as Github or Zenodo.
When ready, click 'Import Workflow' to make the file available to run.
Imported workflows will become available immediately on the main workflow page. To run a workflow, click the play button at the right side of its row.

The initial screen will show all inputs for the workflow. You can run with standard parameters here by inputting files and clicking 'Run Workflow'. Alternatively, you can click below to expand and view all tools used in the workflow.
From the expanded workflow view, you can click on any tool's row to expand it and view the parameters.

slides.alt: Alter parameters in the run page
slides.text: Clicking the pencil icon next to parameters of expanded tools will allow you to change them for this run specifically.
When ready, click 'Run Workflow' to start.
The workflow invocation page will appear, showing how far the workflow run has progressed.
Files will populate the history as they become available. The page may now be exited, and the workflow will continue to run.
